item.title: Battlefield 6 will not have a console-only crossplay option
item.description: Despite an earlier interview with a Battlefield Studios developer suggesting Battlefield 6 would include a console-only cross-play option, Dexerto reports that EA has confirmed otherwise. Instead, console players who choose to disable cross-play will be limited to matchmaking solely within their own platform.

item.title: Gamefact #2
item.description:
The very first Grand Theft Auto launched on MS-DOS and Windows on November 28, 1997. GTA IV released on April 29, 2008â€”a span of 10 years, 5 months, and 1 day.

Today marks 12 years since the release of GTA V (September 17, 2013). In that time, Rockstar has not released another mainline GTA title. Instead, we only saw one handheld spinoff (GTA: Chinatown Wars for PSP and Nintendo DS) and two expansions for GTA IV (The Lost and Damned and The Ballad of Gay Tony).

item.title: Battlefield 6 battle royale mode confirmed
item.description:
EA has confirmed the new mode on their latest community update. It’s not clear if the mode will make it on launch, but you can play test now through Battlefield Labs. For more information on Battlefield Labs and how to sign up, visit the link below.

EA mentions some key elements that differ from other BRs,

item.title: Update: Cyberpunk 2077 devs debunk any kind of announcement for September 4, 2025
item.description:
ORIGINAL

Fans online speculate that an announcement is coming for Cyberpunk 2077 on September 4, 2025 following a tweet from the developers which roleplays as N.U.S.A (The New United States of America) who are seeking to recruit netrunners to help against a cyber security threat.

UPDATE

CD Projekt Red debunks any kind of announcement. In fact, “it’s part of an activity tied to the Phantom Liberty anniversary”.

item.title: Battlefield 6 gameplay changes post-beta
item.description:
Battlefield 6 just concluded it’s last beta session last weekend until full release on October 10th, 2025. Here are some of the changes coming on release. Visit the link below for the full list of changes.

  • M87A1 shotgun will now require more pellets to secure a kill.
  • Momentum, especially horizontal speed, carried from a slide into a jump has been reduced.
  • There is now a greater penalty for consecutive jumps.

Read the full update here

item.title: Bungie CEO is stepping down
item.description: Pete began working at Bungie in 2003, when it was still part of Microsoft. He became CEO in 2016 and has held the role until now. Justin Truman, who started at the company in 2010 and worked as a General Manager on Destiny 2, has been appointed as the new Studio Head.
